            var bloxServiceVerified = $.cookie('tncms-services-verified');

                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */

                $.getJSON("http://www.nwitimes.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */
            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));
                    $(this).show();
                });
                $('.subscriber-hide').show();
            }

            // show main content div
            $('#site-container').show();

            // hide loading spinner
            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>MERRILLVILLE | Swimming remains prohibited at Hidden Lake Park
while the Ross Township trustee continues to address an E. coli
issue.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>Trustee Joseph Shudick said the water has been treated, and it
has been tested twice recently.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/nwitimes.com/news/local/lake" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Shudick said one of the tests showed the pond was clear, but
another indicated bacteria was in the water. He said additional
testing is planned to determine if the treatment worked.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Ross Township Board member Ron Dudley said feces from animals,
including geese and ducks, are causing the problem. Dudley said
aerators could improve the issue by circulating the water.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/nwitimes.com/news/local/lake" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/nwitimes.com/news/local/lake" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<div class="subscriber-only"><p>While the devices could be beneficial, Shudick said limited
funding at the trustee's office has prevented it from purchasing
aerators.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>He said the trustee's office is contemplating multiple options
to increase revenue, including attracting more softball tournaments
to the park at 6355 Broadway.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The Ross Township Board decided early this year to prohibit
swimming in the water until the problem is corrected. An orange
fence continues to block people from entering the water from the
beach area.</p>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

<div class="infinity-summary-container hidden-print" id="infinite-container">
<div data-next-url="http://www.nwitimes.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=33ca0dc9-5a33-56f5-a4fe-9a67fb15fcbc&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube" id="infinite-more">
<i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i>
</div>
</div>
<script>
        
            var bFoundOrigin = true;
            var sOriginID = null;
        
        var sOriginURL = scrubURL('http://www.nwitimes.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=33ca0dc9-5a33-56f5-a4fe-9a67fb15fcbc&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube'); // original url scrubbed for preview
        var sFirstID = null;
        var bFirstRun = true;
        var bShowAd = true;
        var bInfiniStop = false;

        function populateInfinitySet(sURL) {
            sURL = scrubURL(sURL);

            // Until the origin paramter for cms.search.mlt functions, we have to start/stop the looping on our own
            // This will require not displaying any assets until we hit oAsset.
            // Then we loop through and display until we've been through everything up to our origin

            $.ajax(sURL).then(function(oResponse, sStatus, oXHR) {

                var sNextUrl = null;

                if (typeof oResponse.next_url == 'undefined') {
                    // URL supplied is no good. Revert to original URL
                    sNextUrl = sOriginURL;
                } else {
                    sNextUrl = scrubURL(oResponse.next_url);
                }

                // Manage response
                if (typeof oResponse.assets != 'undefined' && oResponse.assets.length > 0) {
                    
                    // Remove old more data
                    $("#infinite-more").remove();

                    
                    // Build infinity set
                    $.each(oResponse.assets, function(index) {
                            if (index == 1 && sOriginID == null) {
                                sOriginID = oResponse.assets[0].id;
                            }
                        // Display assets once origin is found
                        if (bFoundOrigin == true) {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                bInfiniStop = true;
                                sNextUrl = null;
                                $("#infinite-more").remove();
                                
                            } else if (bInfiniStop == false && this.id != '33ca0dc9-5a33-56f5-a4fe-9a67fb15fcbc') {
                                // Display asset
                                var sHTML = '';
                                if (this.content) {
                                    sHTML += '<div class="infinite-item original row"><div class="col-md-8">' + this.content + '</div><div class="col-md-4 text-center">';
                                    if (bShowAd == true) {
                                        // Show advertisement
                                        sHTML += '<div class="infinity-ad empty"></div>'
                                        bShowAd = false;
                                    } else {
                                        bShowAd = true;
                                    }
                                    sHTML += '</div></div><hr>';
                                }
                            }
                        } else {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                // Origin found. Begin displaying assets
                                bFoundOrigin = true;
                            } else {
                                // Origin found is false. Skip asset
                                // Fail-safe in case origin is not present in set. This can be removed when origin is fixed.
                                if (bFirstRun == true) {
                                    // Stored first id
                                    sFirstID = this.id;
                                    bFirstRun = false;
                                } else if (this.id == sFirstID) {
                                    // We've started again. Force origin
                                    sOriginID = sFirstID;
                                    bFoundOrigin = true;
                                } // end Fail-safe
                            }
                        }
                        // Append infinity set to container
                        $("#infinite-container").append(sHTML);
                    });

                    // Include block_id on newly added list items
                    $('#infinite-container .infinite-item.original').each(function() {
                        var sHref = scrubURL($(this).find(".card-headline a").attr("href"));
                        
                        // Add to image and headlines links
                        $(this).removeClass('original')
                            .find(".card-headline a, .image a")
                            .attr("href", sHref + "#tncms-source=infinity-scroll-summary-siderail-latest");
                    });

                    // Check next URL
                    if (sNextUrl) {
                        // if origin hasn't been found yet and we hit next_url. Trigger the set to pull in again.
                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://www.nwitimes.com/tncms/block/1429668/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

Los Padres Estates under ‘Boil Water’ Order as Service Restored

  • Jim Parsons (president of Krista Water Company) checks the water flow from the newly installed pump which became operational Thursday at 3:30 p.m. Krista service was returned to homes but residents must boil water until the state tests give an "all clear."[Pete Mack photo, special to The Mountain Enterprise]

LEBEC, CA /Los Padres Estates (August 26, 2011 at 3 p.m.)— At 3:30 p.m. Friday the Krista Water Company confirmed it has resumed service to Los Padres Estates. A "boil water" order is in force, as the pipes are again put into service. The boil water order will continue until the State Department of Health tests are complete and clear.

Water from the Lebec County Water Company was being delivered to Krista’s tanks by truck for most of the week, Community Reporter Chandra Mead reported. Steve Cozzetto, president of the LCWD confirmed the arrangement on Thursday.

Pete Mack of Lebec reports that the problem began last Sunday when it was noted that there was no flow from the pump. When the well pipe was pulled, the upper casing from the pump fractured, allowing the pump to break away and fall to the bottom of the well, taking with it all of the electric cable which was piled on top of it.

This is part of the August 26, 2011 online edition of The Mountain Enterprise.

Have an opinion on this matter? We'd like to hear from you.

Pescadero Remains Under Boil Order

    NEWSLETTERS

    Receive the latest local updates in your inbox

    Privacy policy | More Newsletters

    Residents in the rural San Mateo County community of Pescadero are  being asked to continue to boil drinking water after a pump that broke  earlier this week was replaced early Wednesday morning.

        The county's director of public works said the state Department of  Health had yet to deem the water potable, but that the boil notice in effect  was expected to be lifted within one or two days.     More than 100 customers -- including homes, restaurants,  businesses and schools -- lost their water supply when the pump stopped  functioning late Monday night or early Tuesday morning, according to San  Mateo County Public Works Director Jim Porter.
        After initial efforts to repair the pump failed, its replacement  was ordered and shipped from Salinas, some 70 miles away, Porter said. Public  Works staff worked through the night to extend a well intake pipe and install  the replacement pump, which was put in operation shortly after midnight  Tuesday.
        Porter said Thursday morning that the community's 140,000-gallon  storage tank was being replenished at a rate that would take about 40 hours  to reach capacity.
        Public Works and state public health staff are working to  disinfect and test the system's water, and Porter said that parts of the  system may need to be flushed with chlorine to disinfect water in the  distribution system. This could require staff to open some fire hydrants  around Pescadero, he said.
     

    Published at 4:28 PM PDT on Aug 25, 2011

<a class="h6 gray-dark-link text-capitalize block-display air-xxs" href="https://patch.com/california/halfmoonbay/politics">politics & government</a> <h1>
      Water Service Restored to Pescadero    </h1>
<h2 class="h4">Residents still being advised to boil water until tests confirm it is safe to drink from the tap.</h2> <div class="clearfix summary-additional">
<span class="h6">By <a href="https://patch.com/users/kristine-wong">Kristine Wong, <span class="text-neutral">Patch Poster</span> </a> | <time datetime="2011-08-24 17:26:53">Aug 24, 2011 5:26 pm ET</time> | Updated <time datetime="2011-08-24 17:49:17">Aug 24, 2011 5:49 pm ET</time><a class="edit-p soft-hide gray-subtle-link" href="https://my.patch.com/article/2092571/edit" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" title="Moderate Content."><span class="separator"></span> <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-paragraph fa-xs"></span></a></span><div class="flag-fb-like-wrapper air-xs-t"><div class="fb-like" data-action="like" data-href="https://patch.com/california/halfmoonbay/water-service-restored-to-pescadero" data-layout="button_count" data-share="true"></div></div> </div>
</div>
</section> <!-- /.block -->
</div>
</header> <!-- /#page-header -->
<div class="row">
<section class="col-md-8">
<a id="main-content"></a>
<div class="region region-content">
<section class="block block-system clearfix" id="block-system-main">
<div class="article-page-default not-posted-today">
<section id="beginning-of-article"></section>
<div class="social-share-wrapper"><div class="social-share text-center"><a alt="Share on Facebook" category="social" class="social-btn social-btn-facebook" Restored to Pescadero”"><span class="fa fa-2x fa-comments"></span><span class="disqus-comment-count p bold visible-lg-block visible-md-block visible-sm-block visible-xs-inline-block" data-disqus-identifier="2092571">0</span></a></div></div>
<div class="content-main-image">
<img alt="Water Service Restored to Pescadero" class="img-responsive center-block" src="https://cdn.patchcdn.com/users/44721/2011/08/T800x600/483b2174c3f6d28b97572da6ce2084ca.jpg"/> </div>
<div class="slideshow-carousel ">
<ul class="list-inline"><li class="first"><img alt="Water Service Restored to Pescadero-0" class="img-responsive article-slideshow-image" data-lazy-pseudo="https://cdn.patchcdn.com/users/44721/2011/08/T800x600/483b2174c3f6d28b97572da6ce2084ca.jpg" src="https://cdn.patchcdn.com/users/44721/2011/08/T200x150/483b2174c3f6d28b97572da6ce2084ca.jpg" width="80"/></li>
<li class="last"><img alt="Water Service Restored to Pescadero-1" class="img-responsive article-slideshow-image" data-lazy-pseudo="https://cdn.patchcdn.com/users/44721/2011/08/T800x600/3a231bd04340522d2cb07e7ccc895232.jpg" src="https://cdn.patchcdn.com/users/44721/2011/08/T200x150/3a231bd04340522d2cb07e7ccc895232.jpg" width="80"/></li>
</ul> </div>
<div class="content-body center-block" id="article-wrapper">
<p>Water service has been restored to the rural San Mateo County community of Pescadero after a broken pump for more than 24 hours, according to the director of public works.</p> <p>To see coverage of the incident from Half Moon Bay Patch, click .</p> <p>The pump stopped functioning late Monday night or early Tuesday morning, San Mateo County public works director Jim Porter said today.</p> <p>Initial efforts to fix the system failed, and a new pump had to be ordered from Salinas, delivered to the isolated coastal town and installed, Porter said.</p> <p>Water was shut down most of Tuesday to more than 100 connections in the area, Porter said, which included homes, restaurants, businesses and schools.</p> <p>At about 1:30 a.m. Wednesday morning, the new pump started working and water service was restored, Porter said.</p> <p>Residents are being advised to boil drinking water until state and local officials can run enough tests to confirm the purification system is working and the water supply is potable, Porter said.</p> <p>"Until we get word from the state that the water is ok, there is a boil order in place," Porter said.</p> <p>"We should have that done in a day or two," he said.</p> <p>- Bay City News</p> <p><strong>To receive news feeds about Half Moon Bay and the unincorporated Coastside between Montara and Pescadero, visit Half Moon Bay Patch on Facebook and "like" us</strong> <strong> <a href="http://www.facebook.com/HalfMoonBayPatch" rel="nofollow">here</a>. Follow us on Twitter <a href="http://twitter.com/#%21/HMoonBayPatch" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</strong></p><div id="in-article-boxed-recirc"><div class="text-center air-md"><a category="subscribe" class="btn btn-lg btn-cta-alt pill sans in-article-subscribe l-bold" href="/" trigger="article_button_click">   Subscribe  <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-angle-right fa-lg"></span></a></div></div> </div>

// increment counter on new assets

            var bloxServiceVerified = $.cookie('tncms-services-verified');

            /* if service not whitelisted check user service */
            if( bloxServiceVerified != 1 ){
                var bloxServiceIDs = [];
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4355);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4212);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4435);

                if (__tnt.user.services){
                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */
            if( !bloxHasSubscription && !bloxServiceVerified && typeof userWhiteList != 'undefined' && $.isArray(userWhiteList) ) {
                $.getJSON("http://www.emissourian.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */
            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));
                    $(this).show();
                });
                $('.subscriber-hide').show();
            }

            // show main content div
            $('#site-container').show();

            // hide loading spinner
            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });

<div class="asset-content subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<style>#ndn-video-player-1.ndn_embedded .ndn_floatContainer { margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 20px; }</style>
<div class="ndn-container p402_hide">
<div class="ndn_embed" data-config-distributor-id="80015" data-config-height="9/16w" data-config-width="100%" id="ndn-video-player-1"></div>
<script type="text/javascript">var _ndnq = _ndnq || []; _ndnq.push(['embed']);</script>
</div>
<style>#ndn-video-player-2.ndn_embedded .ndn_floatContainer { margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 20px; }</style>
<div class="ndn-container p402_hide">
<div class="ndn_embed" data-config-distributor-id="80015" data-config-height="9/16w" data-config-width="100%" id="ndn-video-player-2"></div>
<script type="text/javascript">var _ndnq = _ndnq || []; _ndnq.push(['embed']);</script>
</div>
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>The city will issue boil advisories in the future whenever they
are deemed necessary, City Administrator Rick Childers told the St.
Clair Board of Aldermen during its most recent meeting.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>However, he said a boil order probably will not be issued.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>"It's worthwhile to note that the city will not issue a boil
order because unless this board gives us the specific authority to
do so, we can't order anyone to boil their water," he said on Aug.
15. "We can advise them, and we should do that each and every time
the pressure within any part of the system falls to less than 20
pounds per square inch."</p>
</div>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset, atf","fold":"above","include_domain":null,"size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com\/emissourian.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/news"}' style="display:none;"></div>
<div data-refreshable="true" data-region="fixed-big-ad-top-asset"><div class="tncms-region-ads" id="tncms-region-ads-fixed-big-ad-top-asset">
<div id="blox-ad-position-fixed-big-ad-top-asset1">
<script type="text/javascript">TNCMS.AdManager.render({region: 'fixed-big-ad-top-asset', slot: 1, fold: "above"});</script>
</div>
</div>
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Recently, that happened.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>On Friday morning, Aug. 5, a boil advisory was issued through
the end of the day Saturday after a water line leak was discovered
along Roller Road on the city's west side. The leak originally was
discovered at about 4 p.m. on Thursday, and city employees had it
repaired by about 3:30 a.m. on Friday.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The advisory was issued as a precaution.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p> Childers said in order to repair the leak, city employees had
to shut off the water pumps and towers and let the pressure in the
system decrease.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>"Anytime the pressure drops, as a precaution it's good practice
to issue a boil advisory," he said at the time.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The Missouri Department of Natural Resources requires all public
water systems to maintain a minimum pressure of 20 pounds per
square inch. When that fails to happen, appropriate action needs to
be taken, Childers said. And part of that appropriate action is to
inform residents as best as city officials can.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>"This has not apparently been a consistent practice in the
past," Childers said. "But with more attention to water system
operations and more strict reporting and notification requirements,
it's something we are going to adhere to as strictly as we
can."</p>
</div>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset, stf","fold":"span","include_domain":null,"size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com\/emissourian.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/news"}' style="display:none;"></div>
<div data-refreshable="true" data-region="fixed-big-ad-middle-asset"><div class="tncms-region-ads" id="tncms-region-ads-fixed-big-ad-middle-asset">
<div id="blox-ad-position-fixed-big-ad-middle-asset1">
<script type="text/javascript">TNCMS.AdManager.render({region: 'fixed-big-ad-middle-asset', slot: 1, fold: "span"});</script>
</div>
</div>
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Both state and federal licensure and operating requirements
stipulate criteria for issuing a boil advisory, the city
administrator said.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>"Any time any part of the system pressure falls below 20 psi, we
will advise persons served by that part of the system that they may
want to consider boiling their water, especially water used by
infants, the elderly or those with immune system deficiencies.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>"This will not mean that all at once the water system is falling
apart," he said. "It will simply allow those people who might be
impacted by reduced pressure to be advised of the situation."</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Childers said taking these necessary steps is something city
officials have been discussing.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>"This is an operational change that we've been discussing for
more than a month," he said. "But the assistance of the board (of
aldermen) and the press is requested to help let people know that
they'll be hearing more about water pressure in the future than has
been the case previously."</p>
</div>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-bottom-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-bottom-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-bottom-asset, btf","fold":"below","include_domain":null,"size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com\/emissourian.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/news"}' style="display:none;"></div>

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&

            ) {

                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 30;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 30) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||

                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

  • Water boiling order remains after bacteria contamination

Water boiling order remains after bacteria contamination

Wednesday, August 24, 2011 4:43 a.m. CDT by Chris Conley

MARSHFIELD, Wis (WSAU) Residents in the Broadway Manufactured Home Park in Marshfield are being told to boil their drinking water until further notice. Coliform bacteria was found in the well-water.

The well has been treated with chlorine, but more tests are needed to make sure the bacteria has been killed off.

The first positive test for coliform was reported on August 5. The 50 residents who live in the area were notified then. The well was treated five days later. The D-N-R is waiting for final test results.

The bacteria was probably caused by run-off from heavy rain in the area from late July.

<div class="card-body">
<div class="card-headline">
<h3 class="">
<a href="/oklahoma/sports/thundernotes-thunder-readying-for-game-in-mexico-city/article_9b1e697c-4d1f-5372-95c1-7f09b0f65be2.html">
        

        
        ThunderNotes: Thunder readying for game in Mexico City</a></h3>
</div>
<div class="card-lead">
<p>OKLAHOMA CITY — The Oklahoma City Thunder have one more home game than road game this season. That’s because their next one will be played at a neutral site, Mexico City, where they’ll take on the Brooklyn Nets in what is technically a home game for Brooklyn, though the crowd will likely lean more OKC's way. </p>

<div class="asset-content subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">The mandatory boil order for Hughes County Rural Water District 2 has been lifted, allowing Stuart Quick Pic to reopen its kitchen and making way for other businesses in Stuart to reopen.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">A mandatory boil order was put into effect July 22 by the state Department of Environmental Quality for the Hughes County Rural Water District 2. The order was lifted Monday, according to Hughes Rural Water District 2.</p>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset, atf","fold":"above","include_domain":"cnhi\/mcalesternews","size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com\/mcalesternews.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/news\/local_news"}' style="display:none;"></div>
<div data-refreshable="true" data-region="fixed-big-ad-top-asset">
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">The boil order originally went into effect after DEQ tested the RWD 2 water system on July 22.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Customers had complained of dirty water, low-to-no water pressure and that problems had progressively worsened over the last two years.</p>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 30;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 30) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 30);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

/* Older browser (IE8) - not supporting rgba() */
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span{background-color:#ffd966}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_play{border-left:1px solid #ffd966;}

.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .map_download{color: #444444;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .map_download:hover{color: #444444;}

.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable {border: 1px solid #444444 !important;}

/*++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/

.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable{background-color:transparent; border-radius:5px !important;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span{background-color:rgb(255, 217, 102); padding:3px !important; font-size: 20px;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_time{ font-size: 12px !important; width: 50px !important}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_title{ padding:4px !important}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_play{border-left:1px solid rgb(255, 204, 51); border-radius:0 4px 4px 0 !important;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_volume{padding-left:6px !important}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_volume{border-right:1px solid rgb(255, 230, 153); border-radius:4px 0 0 4px !important;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_volume.mute{color: rgba(68, 68, 68, 0.4);}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .map_download{color: rgba(255, 217, 102, 0.4);}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .map_download:hover{color: rgb(255, 217, 102);}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span{color: rgb(68, 68, 68);text-shadow: none!important;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span{color: rgb(68, 68, 68);}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable {border: 1px solid rgb(55, 55, 55) !important;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_title{color: #000; text-shadow:none!important}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable .jp-load-bar{background-color:rgba(255, 217, 102, 0.3);}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable .jp-play-bar{background-color:#ffd966;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_volumeLevel a{background-color:rgb(94, 94, 94); height:80%!important }
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin .playerTable span.map_volumeLevel a.sel{background-color:#444444;}
.mbMiniPlayer.mySkin  span.map_download{font-size:50px !important;}

			map: map,
			title:"3212 Washington Street, columbus indiana"
		});
	}

      component-ddb-728x90-v1-01-desktop

      Water restored in N. Garland County, boil order remains in effect

      Water service has been restored to all customers of the North Garland County Regional Water District who were affected by the recent loss of water pressure to Tank #1 located at the intersection of Highway 7 North and Fox Pass Cutoff Road.

      The system experienced hydraulic problems that prevented the ability to fill and maintain an adequate level of water in Tank #1 to provide service to the customers served by this tank. The situation has been addressed and full service has been restored.

      The system has returned to full normal operation. Protocol has been put in place to prevent this situation from ever occurring again. Furthermore, two alternate methods of charging the system to full capacity have also been developed and are in place at this time.

      The boil water order remains in effect for all customers who lost service and will not be lifted until bacteriological samples collected indicate the water is free of contamination and an adequate disinfectant level is established throughout the system.

      Information via release from North Garland County Regional Water District

            // Reset the meter if the data store is too old.
__tnt.metering.init.push(function(){

    var expireDate = new Date(__tnt.metering.config.date);
    var lastDate = new Date(__tnt.recent.date.get());
    
    expireDate = expireDate.getTime();
    lastDate = lastDate.getTime();
    
    if(Number(lastDate)<Number(expireDate)){
        __tnt.log("resetting restrictions");
        var nextDate = new Date(expireDate+(__tnt.metering.config.days * 86400000));

        __tnt.recent.count.set(0);
        __tnt.recent.date.set(nextDate.getTime());

        __tnt.log(nextDate);
    }
});

// Set the 'read' variable if the current asset is in the recent assets list
__tnt.metering.init.push(function(){
    __tnt.log("checking whether user has read this before");
    
    var recent = __tnt.recent.assets.get();
    var uuid = __tnt.metering.config.uuid;
    
    var check = false;
    var i = 0;
    while(!check && i < recent.length){
        if(recent[i]==uuid){
            __tnt.log("found asset in recent");
            var check = true;
        }
        i++;
    }    
    
    if(check){
        __tnt.log("user has read this already");
        __tnt.metering.config.read = true;
    }else{
        __tnt.log("not read before");
    }
});
// if count is less than registration limit return true
__tnt.metering.access.c.push(function(){
    if(__tnt.recent.count.get()<__tnt.metering.config.reg_limit){

__tnt.metering.access.c.push(function(){

    var sites = ['lm.facebook.com','l.facebook.com','m.facebook.com','news.google.com','news.yahoo.com','facebook.com','twitter.com','t.co','fb.me','plus.google.com','goo.gl','google.com','yahoo.com','drudgereport.com','paid.outbrain.com','rma-api.gravity.com','fark.com','bing.com','tpc.googlesyndication.com','msn.com','reddit.com','hsrd.yahoo.com','aol.com','idrudgereport.com','search.tb.ask.com','aol.com'];
    
    var cleanedReferrer = String(String(window.document.referrer).split('?')[0]).replace(/https\:\/\/|http\:\/\//,'').replace(/www/,'');
    var check = false;
    
    $.each(sites,function(){
        var regexp = String(this).replace(/\./g,'\\.').replace(/\,/g,'|');
    
        if(String(cleanedReferrer).search(regexp)>-1){
            __tnt.log("User arrived from site, entry granted");

        }else{

        }
    });
    
    __tnt.metering.config.referred = check;
    return check;
});
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){

// increment counter on new assets

__tnt.metering.compatibility = function(){
    var compatible = true;

    /* this checks for compatibility with DOM storage */

var bloxHasSubscription = false;
            var bloxServiceVerified = $.cookie('tncms-services-verified');

            /* if service not whitelisted check user service */
            if( bloxServiceVerified != 1 ){
                var bloxServiceIDs = [];
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5594);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4597);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4598);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4600);
                
                if (__tnt.user.services){
                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */
            if( !bloxHasSubscription && !bloxServiceVerified && typeof userWhiteList != 'undefined' && $.isArray(userWhiteList) ) {
                $.getJSON("http://poststar.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */
            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));
                    $(this).show();
                });
                $('.subscriber-hide').show();
            }

            // show main content div
            $('#site-container').show();

            // hide loading spinner
            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });


    </script>

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>ARGYLE -- The village of Argyle will be repairing a damaged
waterline today (Wednesday) on Route 40 near the library. All users
of the village water system will be without water from 9 a.m. until
the job is complete.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/poststar.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>When the water supply is restored, a boil water order will be in
effect until two consecutive days of satisfactory bacteriological
samples are submitted and acknowledged by state Health Department.
The boil water order will remain in effect until advised.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/poststar.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

<div class="infinity-summary-container hidden-print" id="infinite-container">
<div data-next-url="http://poststar.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=bb86491e-c865-11e0-a21c-001cc4c002e0&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube" id="infinite-more">
<i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i>
</div>
</div>
<script>
        
            var bFoundOrigin = true;
            var sOriginID = null;
        
        var sOriginURL = scrubURL('http://poststar.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=bb86491e-c865-11e0-a21c-001cc4c002e0&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube'); // original url scrubbed for preview
        var sFirstID = null;
        var bFirstRun = true;
        var bShowAd = true;
        var bInfiniStop = false;

        function populateInfinitySet(sURL) {
            sURL = scrubURL(sURL);

            // Until the origin paramter for cms.search.mlt functions, we have to start/stop the looping on our own
            // This will require not displaying any assets until we hit oAsset.
            // Then we loop through and display until we've been through everything up to our origin

            $.ajax(sURL).then(function(oResponse, sStatus, oXHR) {

                var sNextUrl = null;

                if (typeof oResponse.next_url == 'undefined') {
                    // URL supplied is no good. Revert to original URL
                    sNextUrl = sOriginURL;
                } else {
                    sNextUrl = scrubURL(oResponse.next_url);
                }

                // Manage response
                if (typeof oResponse.assets != 'undefined' && oResponse.assets.length > 0) {
                    
                    // Remove old more data
                    $("#infinite-more").remove();

                    
                    // Build infinity set
                    $.each(oResponse.assets, function(index) {
                            if (index == 1 && sOriginID == null) {
                                sOriginID = oResponse.assets[0].id;
                            }
                        // Display assets once origin is found
                        if (bFoundOrigin == true) {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                bInfiniStop = true;
                                sNextUrl = null;
                                $("#infinite-more").remove();
                                
                            } else if (bInfiniStop == false && this.id != 'bb86491e-c865-11e0-a21c-001cc4c002e0') {
                                // Display asset
                                var sHTML = '';
                                if (this.content) {
                                    sHTML += '<div class="infinite-item original row"><div class="col-md-8">' + this.content + '</div><div class="col-md-4 text-center">';
                                    if (bShowAd == true) {
                                        // Show advertisement
                                        sHTML += '<div class="infinity-ad empty"></div>'
                                        bShowAd = false;
                                    } else {
                                        bShowAd = true;
                                    }
                                    sHTML += '</div></div><hr>';
                                }
                            }
                        } else {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                // Origin found. Begin displaying assets
                                bFoundOrigin = true;
                            } else {
                                // Origin found is false. Skip asset
                                // Fail-safe in case origin is not present in set. This can be removed when origin is fixed.
                                if (bFirstRun == true) {
                                    // Stored first id
                                    sFirstID = this.id;
                                    bFirstRun = false;
                                } else if (this.id == sFirstID) {
                                    // We've started again. Force origin
                                    sOriginID = sFirstID;
                                    bFoundOrigin = true;
                                } // end Fail-safe
                            }
                        }
                        // Append infinity set to container
                        $("#infinite-container").append(sHTML);
                    });

                    // Include block_id on newly added list items
                    $('#infinite-container .infinite-item.original').each(function() {
                        var sHref = scrubURL($(this).find(".card-headline a").attr("href"));
                        
                        // Add to image and headlines links
                        $(this).removeClass('original')
                            .find(".card-headline a, .image a")
                            .attr("href", sHref + "#tncms-source=infinity-scroll-summary-siderail-latest");
                    });

                    // Check next URL
                    if (sNextUrl) {
                        // if origin hasn't been found yet and we hit next_url. Trigger the set to pull in again.
                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://poststar.com/tncms/block/1421721/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

Posted on August 29, 2011 |
  • Bristol
  • flooding
  • Irene

By Andrew Stein



Update (9/1/11):

BRISTOL — Bristol residents who use the municipal water system were told to boil their water Sunday after officials became aware that flooding may have contaminated a part of the system.

Bristol water users were told to boil their water for five minutes before consuming it until further notice. Officials hoped to rescind the order as early as Wednesday, but at press time the order was still in effect.

The order was issued after officials suspected the New Haven River, swollen by rains from Tropical Storm Irene, inundated the water system’s “spring box,” possibly penetrating the “contact tank” where chlorine is introduced to the town’s water. As a precaution, the entire system was being flushed out and sterilized early this week. This process could take several days and requires three consecutive clean tests before the order can be dropped.

“There was no indication that there was definitely river water in the drinking water system,” said Lance Perlee, who oversees Bristol’s water system for the water management firm Simon Operation Services. 

“To err on the side of caution we issued the boil water alert,” he said. Residents were thus asked to boil their drinking water for five minutes before consuming it.

Water to homes is flowing from the town reservoir, and officials are requesting residents to conserve water.

“We ask people to conserve. Go light on the laundry, short on the shower. Don’t water your gardens. Don’t wash your cars,” said Town Administrator Bill Bryant, who wants to prevent the town’s reservoir from running dry.

In a best-case scenario, the water system would have been up and running and the boil water order dropped on Wednesday. Worst-case scenario: The system will be down until next week, and Bristol residents will be asked to continue boiling and conserving water.

BRISTOL — A boil water order was issued by the town of Bristol on Sunday for all residents who use water from the municipal water system. They should continue to boil their water for five minutes before consuming it until further notice. The order was issued after the New Haven River potentially inundated the water system’s “spring box,” possibly penetrating the “contact tank” where chlorine is introduced to the town’s water. As a precaution, the entire system is being flushed out and sterilized. This process could take several days and requires three consecutive clean tests before the order can be dropped. “There was no indication that there was definitely river water in the drinking water system,” said Lance Perlee, who oversees Bristol’s water system for the water management firm Simon Operation Services. “To err on the side of caution we issued the boil water alert,” he said. Residents are thus asked to boil their drinking water for five minutes before consuming it. Water to homes is currently flowing from the town reservoir, and officials are requesting residents to conserve water. “We ask people to conserve. Go light on the laundry, short on the shower. Don’t water your gardens. Don’t wash your cars,” said Town Administrator Bill Bryant, who wants to prevent the town’s reservoir from running dry. In a best-case scenario, the water system will be up and running and the boil water order will be dropped on Wednesday. Worst-case scenario: The system will be down until next week, and Bristol residents will be asked to continue boiling and conserving water.

PAMLICO COUNTY: Restaurants Ordered To Stop Serving Food

Posted: Mon 12:12 PM, Aug 29, 2011 &nbsp|&nbsp
Updated: Mon 9:05 PM, Aug 29, 2011

Because of possible contaminated water, Pamlico County's health director has ordered all restaurants and food service establishments to immediately stop serving food.

The county says this order remains until further notice.

Other water customers are under a mandatory boil water advisory and mandatory water conservation orders. They are working on getting bottled water and food to the fire departments by this evening.

The county says most of its 13,000 residents and businesses remain without power.

Boil order discontinued for Bald Head

Monday
Aug 29, 2011 at 10:19 AM Aug 29, 2011 at 10:20 AM

Bald Head Island | Residents no longer have to boil water in Bald Head Island, a news release from the Brunswick County village said Monday morning.
Village officials had to shut down the water system Saturday to reduce the risk of home sewer systems overflowing with sewage, and residents were advised to boil any water they use.
Tests of drinking samples showed no harmful bacteria were present in the village's drinking water.

– Shannan Bowen
